body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky--

The undersigned Nicholas Simon a German, and resident of of Louisville, and having a family consisting of a wife and four children all residing with him and dependent upon him for a support, was fined Fifty Dollars at the late Term of the city Court of Louisville for an alleged assault & Battery upon one Philip Follmer also of this city --

Folmer made an insulting remark to petitioner in regard to a neice of said Petitioner, said remark being a very gross insult to Petitioner, and said remark wholly uncalled-for, and unjustifiable-- Petitioner was constrained to resent it, and hed did curse said Folmer-- Folmer retaliated and Petitioner jerked Folmer to the ground and in the scuffle bit the forefinger of said Follmer-- Folmer, was the chief witness and had the testimony pretty much his own way and your Petitioner was fined in the sum of Fifty Dollars as aforesaid -- He relies on Executive clemency and prays a remission of said fine --
The persons who have signed the foregoing petition are the neighbors of the Mr Simons & the statements Contained in the petition, are about as the facts occured

Louisville City Ct
vs
Nicholas Simon
$50,
25th Feby/65
We the undersigned are friends and acquaintances of Nicholas Simon the Petitioner and pray a remission of said fine -- Decr. 20th 1864 --

Fred. Frishe
John Connell J P J C
